generif.text: Claspin has a potentially critical role in replication checkpoint control in mammalian cells
determination of properties of both a tumor suppressor and an oncogene
has a ring-like structure and binds with high affinity to branched DNA molecules.
Claspin has roles in the Chk1 pathway and functions in checkpoint control [review]
cleavage of Claspin by caspase-7 inactivates the Chk1 signaling pathway
Claspin and Chk1 proteins regulate each other and thus ensure the proper cell cycle progression and replication checkpoint control.
the Chk1 pathway is regulated through both phosphorylation of Claspin and its controlled degradation.
These results suggest that while TopBP1 is a general regulator of ATR, Claspin operates downstream of TopBP1 to selectively regulate the Chk1-controlled branch of the genotoxic stress response.
Data suggest that degradation of Claspin by SCFbetaTrCP restrains Chk1 activation.
The SCFbetaTrCP-dependent degradation of claspin is necessary for the efficient and timely termination of the DNA replication checkpoint.
The degradation of Claspin at the onset of mitosis is an essential step for the recovery of a cell from a DNA-damage-induced cell-cycle arrest.
Chk1 can be activated in a claspin-dependent manner leading to cyclin B1 down-regulation and providing the cells of an additional mechanism to inhibit mitosis entry in Hela cells.
phosphorylation of Claspin repeats in human Claspin is important for Claspin function and the regulation of Claspin-Checkpoint kinase 1 interaction in human cells
Tipin is a checkpoint mediator that cooperates with Tim and may regulate the nuclear relocation of Claspin in response to replication checkpoint

human Claspin is found in complex with PCNA, an essential component of the DNA replication machinery, and is released upon DNA replication arrest. dissociation of Claspin-PCNA could be part of the signal leading to Chk1 activation.
downregulation of Claspin protein levels by short interfering RNA resulted in an increase in apoptotic induction both in the presence and absence of DNA damage
Altogether seven different sequence changes were observed, but none of them appeared to associate with breast cancer susceptibility.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
These results demonstrate that phosphorylation of Claspin within the Chk1-binding domain is catalysed by an ATR-dependent kinase distinct from Chk1.
Depletion of Chk1 and Claspin together doubled the percentage of very slow forks, compared with depletion of either protein alone.
Data show that Chk1 and the Claspin-Timeless module of replication forks not only participate in ATR signaling, but also protect stressed forks independently of ATR.
Claspin plays a role regulating replication fork stability that is independent of its function in mediating Chk1 phosphorylation.
Cdh1 reciprocally regulates the Rb pathway through competing with E2F1 to bind the hypophosphorylated form of Rb.

Resequenced CLSPN from the germline of selected cancer families; eight nonsynonymous variants, including a recurrent mutation, were id'd from the germline of two cancer-prone individuals and 5 cancer cell lines of breast, ovarian, & hematopoietic origin.
Data show that the ATR-dependent phosphorylation of Chk1, but not p53, is strongly stimulated by Claspin.
Rad9A-mediated Claspin localization is a vital step during checkpoint activation.
RPA-covered ssDNA not only supports recruitment and activation of ATR but also, through Tipin and Claspin, it plays an important role in the action of ATR on its critical downstream target Chk1
Here, the authors demonstrate that both the NF-kappaB family of transcription factors and their upstream kinase IKK can regulate Claspin levels by controlling its mRNA expression.
The multiple protein-DNA and protein-protein interactions is important for Claspin function during DNA replication and DNA replication checkpoint signaling.

Tethering DNA damage checkpoint mediator proteins topoisomerase IIbeta-binding protein 1 (TopBP1) and Claspin to DNA activates ataxia-telangiectasia mutated and RAD3-related (ATR) phosphorylation of checkpoint kinase 1 (Chk1).
In the presence of BRCA1, endogenous HERC2 interacts with Claspin, a protein essential for G(2)-M checkpoint activation and replication fork stability.
the functions of Claspin and the functional relationship between Claspin and Rad17 were studied.
analysis of claspin expression could be clinically relevant in the diagnosis of HPV-related cervical lesions, in particular when applied to cervico-vaginal cytology
The conserved C terminus of Claspin interacts with Rad9 and ensures timely activation of the ATR-Chk1 pathway.

findings identify claspin as an in vivo substrate for the BRCA1 E3 ligase and suggest that its modification selectively triggers CHK1 activation for the homology-directed repair of a subset of genotoxic lesions
Rad9, Rad17, TopBP1 and claspin play essential roles in heat-induced activation of ATR kinase and heat tolerance.
USP29 interacts with Claspin and is able to deubiquitinate it both in vivo and in vitro.
Functional analyses indicat that the expression TopBP1 and Claspin positively affects the survival of brain cancer cells after exposure to radiation.
And-1 coordinates with Claspin for efficient Chk1 activation in response to replication stress.

found that USP9X regulated the expression and stability of CLASPIN in an S-phase-specific manner. USP9X depletion profoundly impairs the progression of DNA replication forks, causing unscheduled termination events with a frequency similar to CLASPIN depletion, resulting in excessive endogenous DNA damage
Results unveil a new aspect of PERK function and previously unknown roles for Claspin and Chk1 as negative regulators of DNA replication in the absence of genotoxic stress.
The functions of claspin are discussed and how its deregulation may contribute to cancer initiation and progression. [REVIEW]
Claspin is a cell cycle checkpoint adaptor and DNA replication factor. (Review)
These results indicate that the expression of claspin might be a key regulator in the progression of gastric cancer
the data indicate that enhanced levels of Claspin and Timeless represent a gain of function that protects cancer cells from oncogene-induced replication stress in a checkpoint-independent manner.
we show that Cdc7 is required for Claspin-Chk1 interaction in human cancer cells by phosphorylating CKBD (Chk1-binding-domain) of Claspin.
Smoothened Promotes Glioblastoma Radiation Resistance Via Activating USP3-Mediated Claspin Deubiquitination.
Claspin plays an important role in tumor progression in RCC and might be a prognostic marker and novel therapeutic target molecule.
Posttranscriptional control of the replication stress response via TTP-mediated Claspin mRNA stabilization.
OZF is a Claspin-interacting protein essential to maintain the replication fork progression rate under replication stress.
Claspin Overexpression Promotes Tumor Progression and Predicts Poor Clinical Outcome in Prostate Cancer.
Histones on fire: the effect of Dun1 and Mrc1 on origin firing and replication of hyper-acetylated genomes.
Structural basis for recruitment of the CHK1 DNA damage kinase by the CLASPIN scaffold protein.
Overexpression of claspin promotes docetaxel resistance and is associated with prostate-specific antigen recurrence in prostate cancer.
circRNA derived from CLSPN (circCLSPN) is an oncogene in human glioblastoma multiforme by regulating cell growth, migration and invasion via ceRNA pathway.
CLSPN is a potential biomarker associated with poor prognosis in low-grade gliomas based on a multi-database analysis.
The Interaction between CLSPN Gene Polymorphisms and Alcohol Consumption Contributes to Oral Cancer Progression.

BP.term: mitotic G2 DNA damage checkpoint signaling

name: claspin

reactome.name: Activation of ATR in response to replication stress
HDR through Homologous Recombination (HRR) or Single Strand Annealing (SSA)
Processing of DNA double-strand break ends

summary: The product of this gene is an essential upstream regulator of checkpoint kinase 1 and triggers a checkpoint arrest of the cell cycle in response to replicative stress or DNA damage. The protein is also required for efficient DNA replication during a normal S phase. Multiple transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Jun 2010].
